title: Hastings stabbing: Priory Meadow Shopping Centre sealed off after man stabbed in the head
text:

A man has been stabbed in the head following reports of a fight in a shopping centre.

Police and paramedics were called to the Priory Meadow Shopping Centre in Hastings, East Sussex shortly before midday today.

A man, who had suffered stab wounds, managed to make his own way to the nearby Conquest Hospital in the seaside town, before an ambulance arrived.

A spokesman for Sussex Police said: "Officers are appealing for witnesses following a stabbing in Hastings. They responded to reports of a fight at Priory Meadow Shopping Centre around 11.45am.

"A man was taken to the Conquest Hospital with head wounds. His injuries are not life-threatening."

(Image: Daily Mirror)

Inspector Olivia Carroll, of the Hastings Prevention Team, added: "This was an isolated incident involving a number of people possibly known to each other and we have no information at this time to suggest there is a threat to the wider community.

"A knife has been recovered from the scene and our inquiries are ongoing to establish the full circumstances.

"A 37-year-old man from Hastings has been arrested on suspicion of causing grievous bodily harm and remains in police custody at this stage.

"Anyone who saw what happened, or who has any information about the incident, is asked to report it online or call 101."
description: A knife has been recovered from the scene and a 37-year-old man arrested, Sussex Police has confirmed
